document_data.caption: ''A paladin of Ilmater uses glory of the martyr in a battle with skeletons.''
document_data.name: Glory of the martyr
document_data.refs3e: {{cite book/Book of Exalted Deeds|99}}{{cite book/Magic of Faerûn|73, 97}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Glory of the martyr''' was a [[Divine magic|divine]] [[abjuration]] spell for [[paladin]]s that granted a protective ward to multiple subjects, transferring some of their wounds to the spellcaster and healing them if the caster should die. Although created by [[Ilmater]], the Crying God, and used by his [[Church of Ilmater|faithful]], the spell spread to paladins of other faiths.
document_data.Users: The spell could be cast by [[paladin]]s—originally only those of Ilmater, but later of other faiths. It could also be cast by [[champion of Gwynharwyf|champions of Gwynharwyf]].
document_data.Effect:
The ''glory of the martyr'' spell functioned like an advanced version of the ''[[shield other]]'' spell, in that it worked on multiple recipients.{{cite book/Player's Handbook v.3.5|278}}

Furthermore, if the caster of ''glory of the martyr'' died while it was still active, then the spell ended in a burst of [[positive energy]] that healed the linked recipients.
document_data.Components: To function, the spell required each subject and the caster to wear a [[platinum]] ring, valued at 50 [[gp]] or more. These served as a focus.
document_data.History:
The ''glory of the martyr'' spell originated among the [[Church of Ilmater|faithful of Ilmater]], and was created by the Crying God himself. However, it since spread to paladins of other faiths.

A paladin of Ilmater once prayed for ''glory of the martyr'' to protect his allies in the midst of a battle with [[skeleton]] warriors.
